Biostatistics

Biostatistics Research

Advanced statistical methods for clinical research, survival analysis, and healthcare data

Research Focus

Developing and applying advanced statistical methods to address complex questions in medical and public health research, with emphasis on causal inference, survival analysis, and clinical trials methodology.

Survival Analysis

Time-to-event analysis including Kaplan-Meier estimation, Cox proportional hazards models, parametric survival models, and competing risks analysis for clinical outcomes research.

Kaplan-Meier Cox Models Competing Risks

Clinical Trials

Study design, sample size determination, randomization methods, interim analyses, and statistical approaches for analyzing randomized controlled trials and observational studies.

RCTs Adaptive Design Power Analysis

Longitudinal Data Analysis

Mixed-effects models, generalized estimating equations (GEE), and growth curve modeling for repeated measurements and clustered data in healthcare settings.

Mixed Models GEE Growth Curves

Regression Methods

Linear regression, logistic regression, Poisson regression, and advanced regression techniques including penalized regression and machine learning methods for prediction.

GLM Logistic LASSO

Missing Data Methods

Multiple imputation, inverse probability weighting, and sensitivity analyses for handling missing data in clinical research and observational studies.

Multiple Imputation IPW Sensitivity

Bayesian Methods

Bayesian inference, prior specification, MCMC methods, and Bayesian adaptive trial designs for incorporating prior knowledge and uncertainty quantification.

MCMC Prior Elicitation Stan

Statistical Software

R Programming

Advanced R programming for statistical analysis, data visualization with ggplot2, package development, and reproducible research with R Markdown and Quarto.

SAS & Stata

Proficient in SAS and Stata for clinical trials analysis, regulatory submissions, and health economics research with adherence to industry standards.

Python

Statistical computing with Python using pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn, and statsmodels for data analysis and machine learning applications.

Applications in Health Research

Biostatistical methods applied across diverse areas of health research

Pediatric Oncology

Survival analysis and treatment outcome evaluation in childhood cancer patients, including Wilms tumor therapy effectiveness and malnutrition impact on treatment outcomes.

Nutrition Interventions

Statistical analysis of nutrition clinical trials, including generalized additive models (GAMs) and structural equation modeling (SEM) for complex intervention evaluation.

Cardiovascular Research

Analysis of fatty acid profiles and cardiovascular risk factors, applying advanced regression techniques and causal inference methods.

Systematic Reviews

Meta-analysis and evidence synthesis for WHO guideline development, including fixed and random effects models and assessment of heterogeneity.

Statistical Consulting

Available for biostatistical consulting on research design, data analysis, and statistical methodology.

Get in Touch View Publications

Geoffrey Manda

PhD Research Fellow in Biostatistics & Causal Inference at Queen Mary University of London. Advancing statistical methods for global health research.

Editor, CausalAtlas.org
